title: Q1 2025 Product Roadmap Planning
inputContent: Product roadmap discussion for Q1 2025 focusing on mobile app launch and API improvements
summary: The product team aligned on Q1 2025 priorities, with consensus to prioritize the mobile app launch in February and defer the analytics dashboard to Q2. Key discussion points included resource allocation, timeline risks, and competitive positioning. The team identified potential delays in backend API work as a critical risk requiring immediate mitigation.

tasks.title: Complete mobile app beta testing
Finalize API v2 documentation
Design analytics dashboard mockups
Conduct user research for mobile onboarding

risks.description: Backend API delays could push mobile launch to March
risks.mitigation: Add two contractors to backend team; daily standups with engineering leads

risks.description: App Store review process may take 2-3 weeks
risks.mitigation: Submit beta build early; prepare expedited review justification

decisions.description: Allocate $50K budget for mobile app marketing campaign

mom:
# Q1 2025 Product Roadmap Planning

**Date:** January 15, 2025
**Duration:** 90 minutes
**Attendees:** Jennifer Park, Michael Torres, Sarah Chen, Marcus Rodriguez, Emily Watson, David Kim

## Key Decisions
- Analytics dashboard postponed to Q2 2025
- Mobile app launch remains February target
- $50K marketing budget approved

## Action Items
- Sarah: Complete beta testing by Jan 28
- Marcus: API documentation by Feb 5
- David: Share user research findings by Jan 22

## Risks Identified
- Backend API timeline concerns
- App Store review uncertainty

title: Security Audit Review - Critical Findings
inputContent: Security audit report uploaded - 23 findings identified
summary: Security team reviewed third-party audit results revealing 3 critical vulnerabilities requiring immediate attention. The team prioritized authentication flow fixes and database encryption upgrades. All critical issues must be resolved before the mobile app launch.

tasks.title: Patch SQL injection vulnerability in user search
Implement rate limiting on authentication endpoints
Upgrade database encryption to AES-256
Schedule penetration testing for February
Update security documentation and runbooks

risks.description: Unpatched vulnerabilities could lead to data breach
risks.mitigation: 24/7 monitoring enabled; WAF rules updated; incident response team on standby

risks.description: Database encryption upgrade may cause downtime
risks.mitigation: Schedule maintenance window; prepare rollback plan; test in staging first

decisions.description: All critical vulnerabilities must be fixed before mobile launch
Engage external security firm for monthly audits

mom:
# Security Audit Review

**Date:** January 18, 2025
**Severity:** Critical
**Attendees:** James Wilson, Alex Thompson, Priya Sharma

## Critical Findings
1. SQL injection in user search (CVSS 9.1)
2. Missing rate limiting on auth endpoints
3. Database encryption below industry standard

## Immediate Actions
- Alex: Patch SQL vulnerability by Jan 20
- Priya: Database encryption upgrade by Feb 1
- James: Schedule pen testing

## Policy Changes
- Monthly external security audits
- No launches until critical issues resolved

title: Customer Advisory Board - Feature Requests
inputContent: Customer advisory board meeting transcript - 8 enterprise customers present
summary: Enterprise customers provided valuable feedback on workflow automation needs. Top requests included Salesforce integration, advanced reporting, and SSO support. Customers expressed strong interest in the upcoming mobile app but requested offline mode functionality. The team committed to quarterly feature updates and improved communication.

tasks.title: Research Salesforce integration requirements
Design advanced reporting dashboard wireframes
Evaluate SSO providers (Okta, Auth0, Azure AD)
Prototype offline mode for mobile app
Create customer feature request tracking board

risks.description: Salesforce integration complexity may exceed Q1 timeline
risks.mitigation: Scope to read-only integration first; consider partnership with Salesforce consulting firm

decisions.description: Commit to quarterly feature releases for enterprise customers
Launch customer feature voting portal by end of January

mom:
# Customer Advisory Board Meeting

**Date:** January 22, 2025
**Attendees:** 8 enterprise customers + product team

## Top Feature Requests
1. Salesforce integration (6/8 customers)
2. SSO support (7/8 customers)
3. Advanced reporting (5/8 customers)
4. Mobile offline mode (4/8 customers)

## Commitments Made
- Quarterly feature releases
- SSO in Q2 2025
- Public feature voting portal
- Improved release notes

## Customer Sentiment
- Overall satisfaction: 8.2/10
- Mobile app excitement: High
- Support responsiveness: Excellent

title: Sprint 24 Planning - Engineering
inputContent: Sprint planning notes from engineering team - 2-week sprint
summary: Engineering team planned Sprint 24 with focus on mobile app polish and API performance improvements. Team velocity is 42 story points. Key concerns raised about technical debt in notification service and need for refactoring before adding new features.

tasks.title: Optimize API response times for mobile endpoints
Fix mobile app crash on iOS 16
Refactor notification service architecture
Add integration tests for payment flow
Update CI/CD pipeline for faster builds
Document API rate limiting behavior

risks.description: Technical debt in notification service blocking new features
risks.mitigation: Allocate 20% of sprint capacity to refactoring; create technical debt backlog

decisions.description: Dedicate 20% of each sprint to technical debt reduction
Implement mandatory code review for all mobile changes

mom:
# Sprint 24 Planning

**Sprint Duration:** Jan 24 - Feb 7, 2025
**Team Velocity:** 42 story points
**Sprint Goal:** Mobile app stability + API performance

## Sprint Backlog
- Mobile crash fixes (8 pts)
- API optimization (13 pts)
- Notification refactor (13 pts)
- Testing improvements (8 pts)

## Engineering Practices
- 20% time for technical debt
- Mandatory code reviews
- Daily standups at 9:30 AM

## Blockers
- None identified

title: Mobile App Launch Marketing Strategy
inputContent: Marketing strategy deck uploaded - mobile app launch campaign
summary: Marketing team presented comprehensive launch strategy for mobile app including influencer partnerships, paid social campaigns, and PR outreach. Budget approved at $75K with focus on product-led growth tactics. Launch date set for February 15th with soft launch to beta users on February 1st.

tasks.title: Finalize influencer partnership contracts
Create social media content calendar
Design app store screenshots and preview video
Draft press release for TechCrunch pitch
Set up attribution tracking for app installs

risks.description: Influencer content may not align with brand voice
risks.mitigation: Provide detailed content guidelines; require approval before posting

risks.description: App launch delay would waste marketing spend
risks.mitigation: Weekly sync with engineering; contingency budget for date shifts

decisions.description: Soft launch to beta users on February 1st

mom:
# Mobile App Launch Marketing Strategy

**Launch Date:** February 15, 2025
**Soft Launch:** February 1, 2025 (beta users)
**Budget:** $75,000

## Campaign Channels
- Influencer partnerships (3 tech YouTubers)
- Paid social (LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram)
- PR outreach (TechCrunch, Product Hunt)
- Email marketing (existing user base)

## Success Metrics
- 10K app installs in first week
- 4.5+ App Store rating
- 50+ media mentions
- 25% conversion from free to paid

## Timeline
- Feb 1: Beta launch
- Feb 8: Press embargo lifts
- Feb 15: Public launch
- Feb 22: Results review
